s1: Defensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of anomaly / intrusion detection and identification mechanisms.
s2: identify and describe the reasons for many architectural features of contemporary machines.

s1: Students will also learn and exercise handling of an existing intrusion which includes forensic operations as well as securing the remaining systems.
s2: identify and evaluate features of the system library of a particular operating system, and be able to apply this knowledge to program small applications.

s1: This is a complete course in cyber defense which enables students on successful completion to operate systems under real-world exposure.
s2: demonstrate experience in the design and implementation of a large software system.

s2: demonstrate experience in the design and implementation of a large software system.

s2: demonstrate experience in the design and implementation of a large software system.
